text: 5 Seconds of Summer, also known as 5SOS, are an Australian pop rock band formed in 2011 in Sydney, Australia. The group consists of lead vocalist Luke Hemmings, lead guitarist Michael Clifford, bassist Calum Hood, and drummer Ashton Irwin. They have released four studio albums and headlined multiple world tours. All singles from their four studio albums, as well as all four albums, have charted in a substantial number of countries, received multiple official sale certifications and have been featured in a large amount of weekly and year-end charts, as well as making an appearance on decade-end charts. The band has received numerous accolades and awards including being honored with the prestigious APRA Awards Outstanding International Achievement Award in 2019 and being credited in the exclusive APRA AMCOS' The 1,000,000,000 List in 2020.5 Seconds of Summer has been placed on Billboard's Top Artists of the 2010's Chart, which lists the most popular and successful artists of the 2010-2019 decade. ==4Music Video Honours== The 4Music Video Honours is an annual music awards show by 4Music, a music and entertainment channel in the United Kingdom and available on some digital television providers in the Republic of Ireland. {| class="wikitable" style="width:100%;" |- ! width=5%|Year ! style="width:15%;"| Nominated ! style="width:20%;"| Award ! style="width:10%;"| Result ! style="width:5%;"|Ref. |- | 2014 | 5 Seconds of Summer | Best Breakthrough | | |} ==Alternative Press Music Awards== {| class="wikitable" style="width:100%;" |- ! width=5%|Year ! style="width:15%;"| Nominated ! style="width:20%;"| Award ! style="width:10%;"| Result ! style="width:5%;"|Ref. |- | 2014 | 5 Seconds of Summer | New Artist of the Year | | |} ==APRA Awards (Australia)== The APRA Awards in Australia are annual awards to celebrate excellence in contemporary music, which honour the skills of member composers, songwriters and publishers who have achieved outstanding success in sales and airplay performance. {| class="wikitable" style="width:100%;" |- ! width=5%|Year ! style="width:15%;"| Nominated ! style="width:20%;"| Award ! style="width:10%;"| Result ! style="width:5%;"|Ref. |- |rowspan="3"| 2015 |rowspan="2"|"She Looks So Perfect" |Most Played Australian Work |rowspan="2" |rowspan="3"| |- |Pop Work of the Year |- |5 Seconds of Summer |Breakthrough Songwriter of the Year |rowspan=2 |- | 2019 | 5 Seconds of Summer |Outstanding International Achievement Award | |- | 2020 | "Teeth" | Song of the Year | | |- |} ==ARIA Music Awards== The Australian Recording Industry Association Music Awards (commonly known informally as ARIA Music Awards or ARIA Awards) is an annual series of awards nights celebrating the Australian music industry, put on by the Australian Recording Industry Association (ARIA). {| class="wikitable" style="width:100%;" |- ! Awards were presented to the world's best-selling artists and were given based on sales figures provided by the International Federation of the Phonographic Industry (IFPI). The last ceremony was held in 2014. {| class="wikitable" style="width:100%;" |- ! width=5%|Year ! style="width:15%;"| Nominated ! style="width:20%;"| Award ! style="width:10%;"| Result ! style="width:5%;"|Ref. |- |rowspan="6"|2014 |rowspan="2"| 5 Seconds of Summer | World's Best Group |rowspan="6" |rowspan="6"| |- |World's Best Live Act |- |"She Looks So Perfect" |rowspan="2"|World's Best Song |- |"Wherever You Are" |- |"She Looks So Perfect" |rowspan="2"|World's Best Video |- |"Wherever You Are" |} ==Young Hollywood Awards== {| class="wikitable" style="width:100%;" |- ! width=5%|Year ! style="width:15%;"| Nominated ! style="width:20%;"| Award ! style="width:10%;"| Result ! style="width:5%;"|Ref. |- |rowspan="1"|2014 | 5 Seconds of Summer | Breakout Music Artist | | |} == YouTube Creator Awards == {| class="wikitable" style="width:100%;" |- ! width=5%|Year ! style="width:15%;"| Nominated ! style="width:20%;"| Award ! style="width:10%;"| Result ! style="width:5%;"|Ref. |- | - | rowspan="2" | 5 Seconds of Summer | Silver Creator Award | | rowspan="2" | |- | - |Gold Creator Award | |} == Other Accolades == ===APRA AMCOS’ The 1,000,000,000 List === On 18 February 2020, 5 Seconds of Summer was awarded and honored in the APRA AMCOS' The 1,000,000,000 List, which recognizes excellence among Australian songwriting artists who have achieved massive international success. The band was awarded for their single, "Youngblood", reaching over a billion streams. === Listicles === {| class="wikitable plainrowheaders sortable" style="margin-right: 0;" |+ Name of publisher, year listed, name of listicle, and placement |- ! scope="col" | Publisher ! scope="col" | Year ! scope="col" | Listicle ! scope="col" | Placement ! scope="col" class="unsortable" | |- | Forbes | 2015 | 30 Under 30 (Music) | | style="text- align:center;" | |- |Billboard |2019 |Social 50: Decade End (2010-2019) | | |- |Billboard |2019 | Top Artists: Decade End (2010-2019) | | style="text- align:center;" | |- |Yahoo!
